intro: Micromeria notarisii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Its floral structure includes five petals and stamens, typical of the Geraniaceae family, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Micromeria notarisii is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for native pollinators and its role in stabilizing desert soils.
